Detailed Description

HopfCartesianCpg.h provides a simple interface to an implementation of Hopf Central Pattern Generator (CPG) in polar coordinates.

Author:
David Johan Christensen, Modular Robotics Lab, AdapTronics Group, Maresk Institute, University of Southern Denmark
Note:
This software is distributed under the BSD open-source license.

void HCCpg_addCoupling ( float  x1,
float  y1,
CpgSuperCoupling_t *  coupling,
HCCpg_t *  cpg 
)

Add coupling to cpg from another CPG, x1 and y1 are the state variables of the other CPG, coupling specifies the coupling strength and desired phase difference

void HCCpg_coupleDirectlyX ( float  signal,
HCCpg_t *  cpg 
)

Add a coupling directly to the X equation (e.g. feedback from a sensor)

Add a coupling directly to the Y equation (e.g. feedback from a sensor)

Initialize the Component

void HCCpg_initialize ( HCCpg_t *  cpg  ) 

Initialize the Hopf central pattern generator with default parameters

void HCCpg_iterate ( HCCpg_t *  cpg  ) 

Performs one itteration (Runge-Kutta based) of the CPG which will update the state of the CPG

void HCCpg_resetState ( HCCpg_t *  cpg  ) 

Set state to x=1 and y=0 and clears all couplings

void HCCpg_setUpdateRate ( float  updatesPerPeriode,
HCCpg_t *  cpg 
)

Set the number of times HCCpg_iterate(.) will be called in one CPG period.
